bugs.title: CVE-2023-0471 CVE-2023-0472 CVE-2023-0473 CVE-2023-0474 chromium: various flaws [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-0471 CVE-2023-0472 CVE-2023-0473 CVE-2023-0474 chromium: various flaws [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-0471 chromium-browser: Use after free in WebTransport

long_desc.thetext:
An use after free flaw was found in the WebTransport component of the Chromium browser.

Upstream bug(s):

https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1376354

External References:

https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2023/01/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_24.html

Created chromium tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2164337]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2164336]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-0474 chromium-browser: Use after free in GuestView

long_desc.thetext:
An use after free flaw was found in the GuestView component of the Chromium browser.

Upstream bug(s):

https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1400841

External References:

https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2023/01/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_24.html

Created chromium tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2164337]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2164336]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

More information about these security flaws is available in the following bugs:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2164334
http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2164333
http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2164332
http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2164335

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=high

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2164332,2164333,2164334,2164335,2164336

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
FEDORA-2023-fd4786cc83 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 37. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2023-fd4786cc83
FEDORA-EPEL-2023-be3f685654 has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 9. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2023-be3f685654

FEDORA-2023-fd4786cc83 has been pushed to the Fedora 37 testing repository.
Soon you'll be able to install the update with the following command:
`sudo dnf upgrade --enablerepo=updates-testing --refresh --advisory=FEDORA-2023-fd4786cc83`
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2023-fd4786cc83

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

FEDORA-EPEL-2023-be3f685654 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 9 testing repository.

You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2023-be3f685654

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

FEDORA-2023-fd4786cc83 has been pushed to the Fedora 37 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

FEDORA-EPEL-2023-be3f685654 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 9 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.
